properties.title: The open source LDAP directory services in Java
properties.author: ForgeRock AS

section.name: About the OpenDJ Project
section.p: The OpenDJ community actively develops open source directory services, including a high performance, highly available, secure directory server, built-in data replication, client tools, and an LDAP SDK. OpenDJ offers extensive LDAPv3 support. OpenDJ DSML gateway enables applications accessing directory data through DSMLv2. All modules are 100% Java based and require Java 1.6.

Coming soon on the OpenDJ Roadmap, you see that the community plans to add RESTful web services access to the directory, and to develop directory proxy services with virtual directory capabilities such as data mapping and connectors for non-directory data sources.

section.name: Welcome Users
section.p: The OpenDJ community shares an interest in improving and extending OpenDJ software, and in adapting OpenDJ to best fit our needs.
You are welcome to join us. Here are some ways to get started.

ul.li: Download and install a build from the download page.
Join the OpenDJ mailing list to ask questions, make suggestions, and tell us what you think of OpenDJ.
Read and edit OpenDJ Wiki documentation.

section.p: Looking forward to hearing from you.

section.name: Welcome Developers
section.p: If you are a Java developer interested in OpenDJ, there are plenty of ways you can get actively involved in the community in addition to joining as an OpenDJ user.

ul.li: Get the source. See instructions in the Guide to OpenDJ Subversion.
Make sure you register to join the community, thus also registering to report issues, and describe requests for enhancements, as well as to edit OpenDJ Wiki documentation.
Participate and discuss your work on the OpenDJ developer mailing list in addition to the OpenDJ mailing list.

section.name: Welcome Partners
section.p: Want to partner with other OpenDJ community members to bring solutions based on OpenDJ to your customers?

ul.li: Come show off your expertise on the mailing list and in the chat room at irc.freenode.net #opendj.
Post your success stories and white papers on the OpenDJ Wiki.
